summary: Register a post status. Do not use before init.
description:
A simple function for creating or modifying a post status based on the parameters given. The function will accept an array (second optional parameter), along with a string for the post status name.

Arguments prefixed with an _underscore shouldn't be used by plugins and themes.

tags.name: $wp_post_statuses
tags.desc: Inserts new post status object into the list

desc.summary: Array or string of post status arguments.

tags.desc:
A descriptive name for the post status marked
for translation.
tags.name: $label

tags.desc: Descriptive text to use for nooped plurals.
tags.name: $label_count

tags.desc:
Whether to exclude posts with this post status
from search results.
tags.name: $exclude_from_search

tags.desc: Whether the status is built-in. Core-use only.
tags.name: $_builtin

tags.desc:
Whether posts of this status should be shown
in the front end of the site.
tags.name: $public

tags.desc: Whether the status is for internal use only.
tags.name: $internal

tags.desc: Whether posts with this status should be protected.
tags.name: $protected

tags.desc: Whether posts with this status should be private.
tags.name: $private

tags.desc:
Whether posts with this status should be publicly-
queryable.
tags.name: $publicly_queryable

tags.desc:
Whether to include posts in the edit listing for
their post type.
tags.name: $show_in_admin_all_list

tags.desc:
Show in the list of statuses with post counts at
the top of the edit listings,
e.g. All (12) | Published (9) | My Custom Status (2)
tags.name: $show_in_admin_status_list

tags.desc: Whether the post has a floating creation date.
tags.name: $date_floating
$rewrite
tags.defaultValue: true, using $post_type as slug. To specify rewrite rules, an array can be passed with any of these keys:

desc.summary: Triggers the handling of rewrites for this post type. To prevent rewrite, set to false.

tags.name: $a
tags.desc:
Whether posts of this status should be shown
in the front end of the site.
